intro: Saussurea pujolica, commonly known as the Pujol's fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble the fleur-de-lis motif. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers come in shades of white, yellow, and pink. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, Saussurea pujolica is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
